A float occupies 4 bytes. If the hexadecimal equivalent of these 4 bytes are A, B, C and D, then when this float is stored in memory in which of the following order do these bytes gets stored?
options: Depends on big endian or little endian architecture
Floating and Decimal Data Types.explanation:
“Little Endian” means that the lower-order byte of the number is stored in memory at the lowest address, and the high order byte at the highest address. For example, a 4 byte Integer
ABCD will be arranged in memory as follows:
Base Address + 0 Byte 0.
Base Address + 1 Byte 1.
Base Address + 2 Byte 2.
Base Address + 3 Byte 3.
Intel processors (those used in PC’s) use “Little Endian” byte order.
“Big Endian” means that the high-order byte of the number is stored in memory at the lowest address, and the low-order byte at the highest address. The same 4 byte integer would be stored as:
Base Address + 0 Byte 3.
Base Address + 1 Byte 2.
Base Address + 2 Byte 1.
Base Address + 3 Byte 0.

Introduction of Console I/O Operations.question: Which of the classes provide the operation of reading from and writing to the console in C#.NET?

Introduction of Console I/O Operations.explanation: The standard output stream Console.Out sends output to the screen by default.

Introduction of Console I/O Operations.explanation: Console.In is an instance of TextReader, and we can use the methods and properties defined by TextReader to access it to read the input from the keyboard.

Introduction of Console I/O Operations.question: Choose the output returned when an error condition is generated while read() reads from the console.
Introduction of Console I/O Operations.explanation: Read() returns –1 on error. This method also throws an IOException on failure.

Introduction of Console I/O Operations.question: Choose the object of TextReader class.
Introduction of Console I/O Operations.explanation: Console.In is an instance(object) of TextReader class and we can use the methods and properties defined by TextReader to invoke the object console.in.

This method is called ReadKey(). When it is called, it waits until a key is pressed. When the key is pressed, ReadKey( ) returns the keystroke immediately.

Introduction of Stream Classes.explanation: The core stream class is System.IO.Stream. Stream represents a byte stream and is a base class for all other stream classes. It is also abstract, which means that you cannot instantiate a Stream object. Stream defines a set of standard stream operations.

Introduction of Stream Classes.question: Choose the stream class method which is used to close the connection?

Introduction of Stream Classes.explanation: Writes a single byte to an output stream.

Introduction of Stream Classes.explanation: The method used to write the contents of the stream to the physical device.

Introduction of Stream Classes.explanation: Writes a subrange of count bytes from the array buffer, beginning at buffer[offset], returning the number of bytes written.

Introduction of Stream Classes.question: Name the method which returns integer as -1 when the end of file is encountered.
Introduction of Stream Classes.explanation: Returns an integer representation of the next available byte of input. Returns –1 when the end of the file is encountered.

long Seek(long offset, SeekOrigin origin)

Sets the current position in the stream to the specified offset from the specified origin. It returns the new position.

Byte Stream.question: Which among the following is used for storage of unmanaged memory aspects?

Character Stream.question: The advantages of using character stream based file handling are?

Character Stream.explanation: Although byte-oriented file handling is quite common, it is possible to use character-based streams for this purpose. The advantage of the character streams is that they operate directly on Unicode characters. Thus, if you want to store Unicode text, the character streams are certainly the best option.

Character Stream.question: Which among the following classes are used to perform the character based file operations?
Character Stream.explanation: In general, to perform character-based file operations, wrap a FileStream inside a StreamReader or a StreamWriter. These classes automatically convert a byte stream into a character stream, and vice versa.

Character Stream.question: Which method of character stream class returns the numbers of characters successfully read starting at count?
options: int Read(char[] buffer, int index, int count)
int ReadBlock(char[ ] buffer, int index, int count)
Character Stream.explanation: Attempts to read the count characters into buffer starting at buffer[count], returning the number of characters successfully read.

Character Stream.question: Which method among the following returns the integer if no character is available?
Character Stream.explanation: Obtains the next character from the input stream, but does not remove that character. Returns –1 if no character is available.

Fundamental of Generics.explanation: The term generics means parameterized types. Parameterized types are important because they enable us to create classes, structures, interfaces, methods, and delegates in which, the type of data upon which they operate is specified as a parameter.

It is shown here: int Compare(object x, object y). It returns greater than zero if x is greater than y, less than zero if x is less than y, and zero if the two values are equal.

Runtime Type.question: Which mechanism among the following helps in identifying a type during the execution of a program?
Runtime Type.explanation: Runtime type ID is the mechanism that lets identify a type during the execution of a program. Using Runtime type ID we can construct and use objects at runtime.

Runtime Type.question: Select the statement which are correct about RTTI(Runtime type identification)?
options: It allows the type of an object to be determined during program execution
It tells what type of object is being referred to by a base class reference determined by RTTI
Helps in prevention of an invalid cast exception in advance
Runtime Type.explanation: Runtime type identification (RTTI) allows the type of an object to be determined during program execution. RTTI is useful for many reasons. For example, we can discover precisely what type of object is being referred to by a base-class reference. Another use of RTTI is to test in advance whether a cast will succeed, preventing an invalid cast exception.

Runtime Type.question: Select the Keyword which supports the run time type identification?
Which operator among the following supports the operation of conversion at runtime without generating the exceptions?
Which operator among the following is used to perform the operation of boxing, unboxing, reference and identity conversions?
Runtime Type.explanation:
use the as operator, which has this general form:

     expr as type

Here, expr is the expression being converted to type. If the conversion succeeds, then a reference to type is returned. Otherwise, a null reference is returned. The as operator can be used to perform only reference, boxing, unboxing, or identity conversions.

Runtime Type.question: Which operator among the following supplies the information about the characteristics of a typeof?
Runtime Type.explanation: C# supplies the typeof operator. It retrieves a System.Type object for a given type. Using this object, we can determine the type’s characteristics.

Introduction of Reflections.question: Which feature enables to obtain information about the use and capabilities of types at runtime?
Introduction of Reflections.explanation: Reflection is the feature that enables you to obtain information about a type. The term reflection comes from the way the process works: A Type object mirrors the underlying type that it represents. Reflection is a powerful mechanism because it allows us to learn and use the capabilities of types that are known only at runtime.

Introduction of Reflections.question: Choose the namespace which consists of classes that are part of .NET Reflection API?
Introduction of Reflections.explanation:
Many of the classes that support reflection are part of the .NET Reflection API, which is in the System.Reflection namespace.
eg : using System.Reflection;

Introduction of Reflections.question: Choose the correct statement about System.Type namespace.
options: Core of the reflection subsystem as it encapsulates a type
Consists of many methods and properties that can be used to obtain information about a type at runtime
Both Core of the reflection subsystem as it encapsulates a type & Consists of many methods and properties that can be used to obtain information about a type at runtime
Only Consists of many methods and properties that can be used to obtain information about a type at runtime
Introduction of Reflections.explanation: System.Type is at the core of the reflection subsystem because it encapsulates a type. It contains many properties and methods that you will use to obtain information about a type at runtime.

Introduction of Reflections.question: Choose the class from which the namespace ‘System.Type’ is derived?
Introduction of Reflections.explanation: Type is derived from an abstract class called System.Reflection.MemberInfo

Introduction of Reflections.question: The property signifies “Obtains a Module object that represents the module (an executable file) in which the reflected type resides”. Choose the property which specifies the following statement?
Choose the method defined by MemberInfo.
Introduction of Reflections.explanation: MemberInfo includes two abstract methods: GetCustomAttributes( ) and IsDefined( ). These both relate to attributes. The first obtains a list of the custom attributes associated with the invoking object. The second determines if an attribute is defined for the invoking object. The .NET Framework Version 4.0 adds a method called GetCustomAttributesData(), which returns information about custom attributes.

It is used to maintain a FILO list

Maths Class.explanation: Math class contains all the floating point functions that are used for geometry, trigonometry, as well as several general purpose methods. Example : sin(), cos(), exp(), sqrt() etc.

Rounding Functions in C#.explanation: Round() rounds up a variable to nearest integer.

Rounding Functions in C#.question: Which of these classes contains only floating point functions?
Rounding Functions in C#.explanation: Math class contains all the floating point functions that are used for general purpose mathematics methods. Example : sin(), cos(), exp(), sqrt() etc.

Rounding Functions in C#.question: Which of these method returns a smallest whole number greater than or equal to variable X?
Rounding Functions in C#.explanation: Ciel(double X) returns the smallest whole number greater than or equal to variable X.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: Select the type of multitasking methods that exist:
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: There are two distinct types of multitasking: process-based and thread-based.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: Choose the correct statement about process-based multitasking.
options: A feature that allows our computer to run two or more programs concurrently
A program that acts as a small unit of code that can be dispatched by the scheduler
Only A program that acts as a small unit of code that can be dispatched by the scheduler
Both A feature that allows our computer to run two or more programs concurrently & A program that acts as a small unit of code that can be dispatched by the scheduler
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: The process-based multitasking is the feature that allows your computer to run two or more programs concurrently. For example, process-based multitasking allows you to run a word processor at the same time you are using a spreadsheet or browsing the Internet. In process-based multitasking, a program is the smallest unit of code that can be dispatched by the scheduler.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: Choose the statements which indicate the differences between the thread based multitasking and process based multitasking.
options: Process-based multitasking handles the concurrent execution of programs
Process-based multitasking handles the concurrent execution of pieces of the same program
Thread-based multitasking handles the concurrent execution of programs
Thread-based multitasking deals with the concurrent execution of pieces of the same program
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: The differences between process-based and thread-based multitasking can be summarized like this:Process-based multitasking handles the concurrent execution of programs. Thread-based multitasking deals with the concurrent execution of pieces of the same program.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: What is the advantage of the multithreading program?
options: Enables to utilize the idle and executing time present in most programs
Enables to utilize the idle time present in most programs
Both Enables to utilize the idle and executing time present in most programs & Enables to utilize the idle time present in most programs
Only Enables to utilize the idle time present in most programs
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: The principal advantage of multithreading is that it enables us to write very efficient programs because it lets us utilize the idle time that is present in most programs.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: Select the two type of threads mentioned in the concept of multithreading:
Number of threads that exists for each of the processes that occurs in the program:
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: All processes have at least one thread for execution, which is usually called the main thread because it is the primary thread that is executed when our program begins. From the main thread, we can create other threads.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: Choose the namespace which supports multithreading programming?
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: The classes that support multithreaded programming are defined in the System.Threading namespace. Thus, you will usually include this statement at the start of any multithreaded program.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: Which of these classes is used to make a thread?
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: The multithreading system is built upon the Thread class, which encapsulates a thread of execution. The Thread class is sealed, which means that it cannot be inherited. Thread defines several methods and properties that help manage threads.

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: On call of which type of method the new created thread will not start executing?
Multi-threaded Programming – 1.explanation: In multithreading, when a thread is created, it is in the “New” state but does not start executing until explicitly started using a method like Start().

Multi-threaded Programming – 1.question: Which of these methods of Thread class is used to Suspend a thread for a period of time?

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: Which of these keywords are used to implement synchronization?
Which keyword is used for using the synchronization features defined by the Monitor class?
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: The C# keyword lock is really just shorthand for using the synchronization features defined by the Monitor class, which is defined in the System.Threading namespace.

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: What is synchronization in reference to a thread?
options: It’s a process of handling situations when two or more threads need access to a shared resource
It’s a process by which many threads are able to access the same shared resource simultaneously
It’s a process by which a method is able to access many different threads simultaneously
It’s a method that allows too many threads to access any information they require
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: When two or more threads need to access the same shared resource, they need some way to ensure that the resource will be used by only one thread at a time, the process by which this is achieved is called synchronization.

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: Which method is called when a thread is blocked from running temporarily?
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: When a thread is temporarily blocked from running, it calls Wait( ). This causes the thread to go to sleep and the lock for that object to be released, allowing another thread to acquire the lock.

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: What kind of exception is being thrown if Wait(), Pulse() or PulseAll() is called from code that is not within synchronized code?
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: A SynchronizationLockException will be thrown if Wait(), Pulse(), or PulseAll() is called from code that is not within synchronized code, such as a lock block.

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: What is mutex?
options: can be acquired by more than one thread at a time
helps in sharing of resource which can be used by one thread
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: A mutex is a mutually exclusive synchronization object. This means it can be acquired by one and only one thread at a time. The mutex is designed for those situations in which a shared resource can be used by only one thread at a time.

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: What is Semaphore?
options: Grant more than one thread access to a shared resource at the same time
Useful when a collection of resources is being synchronized
Make use of a counter to control access to a shared resource
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: A semaphore is similar to a mutex except that it can grant more than one thread access to a shared resource at the same time. Thus, the semaphore is useful when a collection of resources is being synchronized. A semaphore controls access to a shared resource through the use of a counter. If the counter is greater than zero, then access is allowed. If it is zero, access is denied.

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: Which method is used to abort thread prior to it’s normal execution?
Which of these statements is incorrect?
options: By multithreading CPU idle time is minimized, and we can take maximum use of it
By multitasking CPU idle time is minimized, and we can take maximum use of it
Two thread in Csharp can have same priority
A thread can exist only in two states, running and blocked
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: Thread exists in several states, a thread can be running, suspended, blocked, terminated & ready to run.

Multi-threaded Programming – 2.question: What is multithreaded programming?
options: It’s a process in which two different processes run simultaneously
It’s a process in which two or more parts of same process run simultaneously
It’s a process in which many different process are able to access same information
It’s a process in which a single process can access information from many sources
Multi-threaded Programming – 2.explanation: Multithreaded programming a process in which two or more parts of same process run simultaneously.

Iterators.question: What is an iterator?
Iterators.explanation: An iterator is a method, operator, or accessor that returns the members of a set of objects, one member at a time, from start to finish.

Fundamentals of Preprocessors.question: Choose the symbol which begins a preprocessor directive in C#.NET?
What is meant by preprocessor directive in C#.NET?
options: a form of command which are interpreted by the compiler
a form of macros like in c and c++ not exactly same to them, separately designed for C#.NET
always begins with a ‘#’ character occupies separate line of source of code
Fundamentals of Preprocessors.explanation: Preprocessor directives are commands that are interpreted by the compiler and affect the output or behavior of the build process. The C# compiler does not have a separate preprocessor, like C and C++ we cannot use these directives to create macros. Preprocessing directives are top lines in our program that start with ‘#’. The ‘#’ is followed by an identifier that is the directive name.

Fundamentals of Preprocessors.question: What is meant by preprocessor directive #define?
options: helps in determining existence and non existence of a symbol
can be used to create function like macros as in C/C++
Fundamentals of Preprocessors.explanation: The #define directive defines a character sequence called a symbol. The existence or nonexistence of a symbol can be determined by #if or #elif and is used to control compilation. #define which supports creation of function like macros in c/c++ does not support the same in C#.

Fundamentals of Preprocessors.question: Select the defined preprocessor in C#.NET?
What does preprocessor directive #if and #endif explains?
options: Enables compilation of sequence of code on condition basis
Express results into true or false on evaluation of condition
If expression following #if is true then code that is between #if and #endif is compiled otherwise skipped
Fundamentals of Preprocessors.explanation: The #if and #endif directives enable conditional compilation of a sequence of code based upon whether an expression involving one or more symbols evaluates to true. A symbol is true if it has been defined. It is false otherwise. If the expression following #if is true, the code that is between it and #endif is compiled. Otherwise, the intervening code is skipped. The #endif directive marks the end of an #if block.

Fundamentals of Preprocessors.question: Which preprocessor directive among the following forces the compiler to stop the compilation?
Fundamentals of Preprocessors.explanation: The #error directive forces the compiler to stop compilation. It is used for debugging. The general form of the #error directive is #error error-message. When the #error directive is encountered, the error message is displayed.

Fundamentals of Preprocessors.question: Which among the following is not a preprocessor directive?

Fundamental of Networking.question: Which namespace is mostly preferred for the operation of networking in C#?
Fundamental of Networking.explanation: Networking support is contained in several namespaces defined by the .NET Framework. The primary namespace for networking is System.Net. It defines a large number of high-level, easy-to-use classes that support various types of operations common to the Internet. Several namespaces nested under System.Net are also provided. Example: System.Net.Mail.

Fundamental of Networking.question: Which of the following are the classes defined by the namespace System.Net?
Which of the following are the interfaces defined by the namespace System.Net?

Fundamental of Networking.question: Which of the following are the classes that support the standard HTTP protocol?
Fundamental of Networking.explanation: The derived classes that support the standard HTTP protocol are HttpWebRequest and HttpWebResponse.

Fundamental of Networking.question: Which of the following class/classes supports the task of uploading and downloading the file?
Fundamental of Networking.explanation: If we only need to upload or download a file, then WebClient is often the best way to accomplish it.

How many bits are present in a single IP address?

Fundamental of Networking.question: Which of the following are the protocols defined by .NET runtime?
Fundamental of Networking.explanation: The .NET runtime defines HTTP, HTTPS, file, and FTP protocols. Thus, if we specify a URI that uses HTTP prefix, we will automatically receive the HTTP-compatible class that supports it. If we specify a URI that uses FTP prefix, we will automatically receive the FTP-compatible class that supports it.

URI Class.explanation: MIME is an internet standard for communicating multimedia content over email. The HTTP protocol uses and extends the notion of MIME headers to pass attribute pairs between HTTP client and server.

URI Class.question: Which of these data members of HttpResponse class is used to store the response from a http server?
URI Class.explanation: When we send a request to http server it responds with a status code. This status code is stored in statusCode and the textual equivalent is stored in reasonPhrase.

URI Class.question: Which of these classes is used to access actual bits or content information of a URL?
URI Class.explanation: URL, URLDecoder and URLConnection – all these are used to access information stored in the URL.

Type Interface.question: Select the type argument of open constructed type?
Type Interface.explanation: A generic type, such as Gen<T>, is an abstraction. In C# terminology, a construct such as Gen<T> is called an open constructed type, because the type parameter T (rather than an actual type, such as int) is specified.

String Formatting – 1.question: Choose the base class for string() method.
String Formatting – 1.explanation: String is an alias for the predefined “System.string” class from which most of the string() methods are derived.

String Formatting – 1.question: What is the value returned by the function CompareTo() if the invoking string is less than the string compared?

String Formatting – 1.question: Which of these methods of class String is used to check whether a given string starts with a particular substring or not?
